I want to give you new news. We have a new twitter account as an institution: @tccankaya.
I will continue to use my existing twitter account.
My new account will also be used by my consultants so that we will share all kinds of development with you faster.
I suggest you follow the @TCC account. In addition to the agenda of the Presidential office,
it will enable you to follow my everyday, cultural and social agenda.
We returned from Ghana and Gabon last night. Ghana and Gabon are the two countries we visited in the framework of the African expansion that we have conducted in recent years.
Turkey is building on its win-win principle of its relations with Africa.
Unlike the other countries in the region, I saw stability in both countries.
There is a sustainable and democratic system in Ghana. In Gabon, the democratic tradition is new and they are watching Turkey well
In both countries there are serious potential business associations in many areas. The businessmen I went with went back to important agreements.
Our investors can do a lot of things in these virgin and hospitable soils.
Of course, as in every African trip, I think we have neglected Africa for a long time.
Now is the time to rebuild the ties we have neglected.

Foreign Minister Kasit is entering the jigsaw puzzle, explaining that the Thai government is working with Cambodia. Like Malaysia, Laos and Burma (the team)
Repeated TOR determines the steps. The survey is divided into 5 steps as follows: 1. Find the main boundary 73 original (per) team.
Make a map of aerial photographs scale 1: 25,000 across boundaries. 3. Dragging to explore on aerial map (cont.)
4. Terrain Monitoring And the last step is 5. Staking the team boundaries.
Deputy military map Also describe the watershed. The ridge or the high water divide into two. Which led to the use of national boundaries (team).
The deputy military map also states that most watershed areas are unlikely to change except for destruction, which may be the cause of the watershed failure. (Team)
Mr Thaksin wrote a letter to the World Heritage Committee on the issue that Cambodia had given him a temple as a World Heritage Site to do the demarcation work.
The map officer also added, "The survey of the boundaries surveyed is still in the first stage. There are many more steps to be taken (the team).
Mr Kasit added that everything was in the process of negotiations and agreed. There is no land lost. What do you do?
